block.p: The five most e-mailed articles from nytimes.com/sports for March 31 to April 6.
1. AS CHEERLEADERS SOAR HIGHER, SO DOES THE DANGER -- More acrobatic maneuvers in high school and college result in more catastrophic injuries. (Published March 31)
2. GEORGETOWN PLAYER'S IGNOMINIOUS MARK -- Marc Egerson's questionable high school academic background. (March 30)
3. ABE COLEMAN, WRESTLER KNOWN AS HEBREW HERCULES, DIES AT 101 -- Obituary. (April 2)
4. DUBAI MELDS TRADITION AND MODERNITY IN WORLD'S RICHEST HORSE RACE -- Horsemen and business magnates from Europe, the United States and Asia gather in a desert sheikdom. (March 31)
5. OHIO STATE VS. FLORIDA, A NEW RIVALRY -- The two universities played for football and basketball championships in the same year. (April 2)
